title: patching a MODULE.bazel fails with permission denied in 8.4.x with experimental_repository_cache_hardlinks

labels.name: team-ExternalDeps
labels.description: External dependency handling, remote repositiories, WORKSPACE file.

labels.name: team-Core
labels.description: Skyframe, bazel query, BEP, options parsing, bazelrc

body:
### Description of the bug:


If you apply a patch to a `bazel_dep` using `single_version_override`, and that patch touches that module's `MODULE.bazel`, and you're using `--experimental_repository_cache_hardlinks`, then bazel will fail to fetch that module with an error that looks like:
```
WARNING: Download from https://bcr.bazel.build/modules/rules_license/1.0.0/MODULE.bazel failed: class com.google.devtools.build.lib.vfs.FileAccessException $BAZEL_CACHE/ae376618862766f0b2f2e7b8bc3b2e4b/external/rules_license+/MODULE.bazel (Permission denied)
INFO: Repository rules_license+ instantiated at:
  <builtin>: in <toplevel>
Repository rule http_archive defined at:
  $BAZEL_CACHE/ae376618862766f0b2f2e7b8bc3b2e4b/external/bazel_tools/tools/build_defs/repo/http.bzl:431:31: in <toplevel>
INFO: repository @@rules_license+' used the following cache hits instead of downloading the corresponding file.
 * Hash '26d4021f6898e23b82ef953078389dd49ac2b5618ac564ade4ef87cced147b38' for https://github.com/bazelbuild/rules_license/releases/download/1.0.0/rules_license-1.0.0.tar.gz
If the definition of 'repository @@rules_license+' was updated, verify that the hashes were also updated.
ERROR: $BAZEL_CACHE/ae376618862766f0b2f2e7b8bc3b2e4b/external/bazel_tools/tools/build_defs/repo/http.bzl:175:52: An error occurred during the fetch of repository 'rules_license+':
   Traceback (most recent call last):
	File "$BAZEL_CACHE/ae376618862766f0b2f2e7b8bc3b2e4b/external/bazel_tools/tools/build_defs/repo/http.bzl", line 175, column 52, in _http_archive_impl
		remote_module_file_integrity = ctx.download(
Error in download: java.io.IOException: Error downloading [https://bcr.bazel.build/modules/rules_license/1.0.0/MODULE.bazel] to $BAZEL_CACHE/ae376618862766f0b2f2e7b8bc3b2e4b/external/rules_license+/MODULE.bazel: $BAZEL_CACHE/ae376618862766f0b2f2e7b8bc3b2e4b/external/rules_license+/MODULE.bazel (Permission denied)
WARNING: Target pattern parsing failed.
ERROR: Skipping ':package_info': no such package '@@rules_license+//rules': java.io.IOException: Error downloading [https://bcr.bazel.build/modules/rules_license/1.0.0/MODULE.bazel] to $BAZEL_CACHE/ae376618862766f0b2f2e7b8bc3b2e4b/external/rules_license+/MODULE.bazel: $BAZEL_CACHE/ae376618862766f0b2f2e7b8bc3b2e4b/external/rules_license+/MODULE.bazel (Permission denied)
ERROR: no such package '@@rules_license+//rules': java.io.IOException: Error downloading [https://bcr.bazel.build/modules/rules_license/1.0.0/MODULE.bazel] to $BAZEL_CACHE/ae376618862766f0b2f2e7b8bc3b2e4b/external/rules_license+/MODULE.bazel: $BAZEL_CACHE/ae376618862766f0b2f2e7b8bc3b2e4b/external/rules_license+/MODULE.bazel (Permission denied)
```

### Which category does this issue belong to?

_No response_

### What's the simplest, easiest way to reproduce this bug? Please provide a minimal example if possible.


run `bazel --ignore_all_rc_files build --experimental_repository_cache_hardlinks  :package_info` in this repo: https://github.com/novas0x2a/repro-patch-module

### Which operating system are you running Bazel on?


linux

### What is the output of `bazel info release`?


release 8.4.2

### If `bazel info release` returns `development version` or `(@non-git)`, tell us how you built Bazel.


_No response_

### What's the output of `git remote get-url origin; git rev-parse HEAD` ?


```text

```

### If this is a regression, please try to identify the Bazel commit where the bug was introduced with bazelisk --bisect.


It is a regression; 8.3.2 works, 8.4.0 fails. The bisected commit that causes the failure is 9541980202679dcbaf866f9bd4f237c9ba65e422.
